content.description:
Impressive and super dangerous old route over roofs and up a black streak.

Since the first pitch only had 2 pieces of pro for the first 90' (including 40' of overhang/overlap climbing), the first a missing piton, there is probably no way to repeat the lead of this route without bringing hammer and thin pins. The pro bolt and anchor bolts have been replaced.
content.protection: missing piton, one bolt, a few thin cams for the top
content.location:
Start by the big three-trunked tree, and climb up and left for 50+ feet, slamming a piton in somewhere. Then work up to the bolt, and climb a long ways above it over roofs and then up a thin black streak to a 2-bolt belay. Some thin pro is available in horizontal cracks above the roofs.

Another pitch or two of easy climbing leads to the top.

climbs.name: Where Your Eyes Don't Go
climbs.fa: Joe Denicola, Greg Barnes, Florence Scholl, Jonathan duSaint, Robin duSaint, 7/10.

content.description:
Fun climb up strange overlaps with a balancy crux (which is easier for those 6'2" or taller - I'm only 6' dang it!). The first pitch is a sport route, the second and third are trad.

Second pitch is 5.9 past a couple bolts, then trad gear, head up flake to ledge, then up and left along horizontal cracks and past a black bulge to a bolted anchor at 105' (a long 60 might just make it on rappel - so use 70 or two ropes...). Third pitch is a 5.8 boulder problem off the belay ledge (don't fall), then easier climbing for a long time (about 180' pitch).

Getting to the first bolt ranges from 5.8 to 5.11 depending on which way you go - perfect flat sandy landing to boulder what you want.
content.protection: 9 bolts first pitch, bolted anchor. Second has 2 bolts, pro to 3" (double thin cams, bring small/med nuts), bolted anchor. Third trad, trad anchor, don't need much. Easy walk off to the right.
content.location: Climbs the large black streak right of Lost Cause (the largest black streak on the wall). The narrow black streak to the right is Working For Peanuts - you will see the old bolted anchor from partway up pitch 2.

climbs.name: Truth and Reconciliation
climbs.fa: E. + L. Stefke, 11/3/20, mostly GU, (last 5 bolts TD)

content.description:
P1 (5.8, PG13) - Climb up the flake/crack (gear) to a point about 5' below the lip/roof.  Clip a bolt out right and move right/up to gain the lip.  Surmount the lip (bolt), then climb up easier ground (!gear!) to a low angle slab.  Climb the slab past two bolts to the anchor.

P2 (10b) - From the anchor move slightly left then up excellent face climbing past two bolts to easier ground.  Pass another bolt straight up to a shallow left facing flake/corner (gear) and another bolt.  From this bolt, move straight left for about 8-10' then find the easiest way up to the next bolt.  Move out left and diagonal up across small holds (10b), toward the left hand edge of the buttress (green alien in slot under lip).  Work the left edge (grainy), past the lip to another bolt and good stance.  Follow the last three bolts (10b) on fine crimps and smears to a big knob and the anchor.

Note: on the FA, my partner and I had quite differing perceptions of the two cruxes on the second pitch.  I thought the first crux was more in the 10b/c range and the second crux 10a.  She thought the first crux was 10a and the second crux 10b.
content.protection: ring anchors, 8 bolts + a handful of cams ranging evenly from green Alien to #2 Camalot, 70m rope
content.location: On the left side of Lost Wall locate a large hanging tablet looking slab about 160' up.  The route approaches that feature from the right, then exits on the left side of the tablet.  Start from a (easily accessible) ledge at a shallow right facing corner/flake/crack and horizontal lip/roof.

content.description: The grey streak just right of Runaway. Free solo first ascent - imagine that while you are wondering if a knob might break on one of the newer routes!
Black streak on the right side of the steep wall.
content.protection: one bolt, thin cams, one 2" cam up high, 2 bolt belay at 160'. Possible to reach the anchor via runout 5.7 knobs from the first pitch anchor of Losing It (about a 50' slightly upward traverse).
content.location: The straight-up black streak right of Losing It. One bolt after the crux bulge, then some thin pro higher up. The crux is completely unprotected and about 30' above a flat granite ledge (and 45' above the ground).

climbs.name: Rock Vixen
climbs.fa: Alan Bartlett, Shari Schubot, Cathy Larson, 8/84.

content.description:
Fun moderate route, but no joke getting to the first pro - a little bit crumbly, and on the R/X side of R since the bolt is about 40-50 feet above a flat granite ledge.

The route wanders above - good route-finding skills are needed to find the easiest way.
content.protection: 1 bolt, pro to 3", extra 1-2" pro. I replaced the bolt in 2001.
content.location: Right of Terrorist, start up the right edge of the roof at a crumbly little bulge/flake - then head up and left to the bolt which is further up than you would like. A small white streak can help find the bolt (caused by rust from the old bolt killing the lichen). Then head up and right and wander your way up the wall. Also has a substantial runout on pitch 2 (getting to the obvious small roof).

content.description: Fun knobby route which passes two roofs, the second one is pretty wild for the grade!
content.protection: 6 draws, optional thin cams, 2 bolt anchor. Runout but easy at start.
content.location: Right of Merely Misplaced. The roofs that are about 30' up split into an upper and a lower one, with inverted-staircase steps up to the upper incut roof (which is about 50 feet up). This route climbs the knobby gray streak straight up to (and over) the left edge of the upper incut roof.

content.description:
Fun easy romp, but with a roof that may be harder for shorter folks. Tuolumne sport, but that means quite runout!

Toproping over the biggest part of the roof below is only 5.10b or so, according to several tall guys at least...
content.protection: 6 bolts, optional thin cams, bolted anchor, 70 m rope for lower-off.
content.location: The left-most route under the large roof on the left of the wall. Start up a left-leaning easy ramp and then work up and right, passing the left side of the roofs about 30' up.

climbs.name: Lost With a GPS
climbs.fa: Greg Barnes, Karin Wuhrmann, Barry Hutten, 10/03.

content.description:
Wandering route with a hollow flake. The crux is a slabby section right at the last bolt (near the top), initially rated 5.9 but consensus is 5.8.

When you reach the flake, save the 1.25" cam until you reach an obvious placement that doesn't sound hollow (not the initial obvious placement which is very hollow)!

I added a bolt in 2010 to protect the initial bulge (since the only other pro is a fixed pin that won't last forever).

Toproping the direct start is about 5.10a.
content.protection: 4 bolts, 1 fixed pin, one 1.25" cam, optional thin cams for start. Two bolt anchor with sport lower-offs.
content.location: Right of Not All Who Wander. Starting up the knobby "tongue" of rock which is a 10' wide flake (tiny dihedrals on either side), climb over a bulge then break sharply right to reach a somewhat loose flake.

climbs.name: Lost Cause
climbs.fa: Greg Barnes, Jonathan duSaint, Joe Denicola, 8/10

content.description:
Cool varied route up face to a left-leaning shallow dihedral and a steep finish. Sustained at the grade - might be 10a (only 1 lead and 1 toprope opinion on rating right now).

Note - about half the bolts on this route are currently 1/4". I'll try to upgrade summer 2011.
content.protection: 8 draws, one 0.75" cam, optional small RP, bolted sport-lower-off anchor.
content.location: Right of Armed Knobbery. Start behind the right edge of the small brushy tree, head up to a micro-thin flake - the first bolt is at the top of the flake at the left. The yellow alien size cam is used under a roof at the top of the route, and the RP can be used a few feet higher.

climbs.name: Losing It
climbs.fa: Joe Denicola, Greg Barnes, Em Holland, Paul Rasmussen, 8/10.

content.description: Cool funky roof/overlap cruxes lead to a gorgeous golden knobby face. Second pitch goes past some golden slab, horizontal cracks, and a knobby bulge to a large ledge with a bolted anchor (5.9, 90'). Third pitch wanders up easy, indistinct climbing (somewhat dirty).
content.protection:
Pitch 1: 10 bolts, bolted anchor, 115' ("short" 70m ropes a bit too short to lower - knot the end of the rope!)

pitch 2: 2 draws, gear 0.3-3", 90', bolted anchor on ledge.

pitch 3: gear 0.6-2", 100', gear anchor. Dirty, not recommended.
content.location: On the right side of the steep section of the wall there is a huge three-trunked tree near the wall. Start behind this and go up and a bit right over the roof, then angle up and left, and at the very top a bit back right to a bolted anchor. A 70m rope just BARELY makes it down - might not if you have a short 70. Second pitch angles left and up past a white bulge to a giant ledge (with absolutely no pro), then left again and back right to the top.

content.description: A fun climb to the right of Finders Keepers, this route is slabby instead of knobby and requires more footwork skill. Look for cams in horizontal cracks to protect the upper part of the route.
content.protection:
4 bolts, double thin to 1.25" cams, bolted anchor. Two ropes to rap.

Possible to climb 2nd pitch to top and walk off (5.5 boulder problem, then 4th class forever).
content.location: About 50' right of Finders Keepers, look for a bolt at the highest slabby ledge.  Climb up, sometimes wandering a bit right, to bolted anchors with chains.

content.description:
Originally toproped by the FA of 'Merely Misplaced,' we were intrigued by the climb.  Fortunately, Jonathan agreed to letting us bolt the roof and we added this enjoyable direct start.  The 10b grade is geared for average height.  Taller individuals may find it easier and shorter climbers may find it significantly harder.

The route joins 'Merely Misplaced' at the fourth bolt.  There is small pro available in a horizontal crack about 10-12' above the 3rd bolt of 'Found.'
content.protection: Six bolts, a couple of small cams (FA used a purple TCU equalized with a yellow/red hybrid alien), ring anchor
content.location: The center of the lowest prominent lip/roof at the center of Lost Wall, pretty much a straight line underneath the anchor of 'Merely Misplaced.'

content.description: Awesome knobby grey/black streak heading up the low-angle wall to the right of Rock Vixen. One long pitch from the uppermost ledge (3rd class), or can be done from the ground with a 70m rope.
content.protection:
4 bolts, pro to 1.5", 2 bolt anchor

Two 60m ropes needed to rap to the 3rd class ledges, or two 70m to the ground, but an easy walk-off to the right if you have one rope.
content.location: The big water streak right of Rock Vixen. Hard to spot the bolts at first!

climbs.name: Armed Knobbery
climbs.fa: Greg Barnes, Denice Hutten, Barry Hutten, 8/01

content.description:
Super knobby route which starts up to a serrated flake about 15' up, then heads straight up the huge knobs. Originally done with no bolts (other than the anchor), but that was pretty dumb...

Make sure to save a 1" cam for the horizontal crack, since the pro in the flake above is hollow.

Possible to tie off a knob or two.
content.protection: 3 bolts, pro 0.5-1.25", double 1" cams (narrow heads best), 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Right of Lost With a GPS, the serrated flake that looks like a cool undercling is the best landmark. Starts about 5-10 feet left of a small brushy tree.
